title: Top 10 Spring Home Maintenance Tips for Austin Homeowners
description: Get your Austin home ready for spring with these essential maintenance tips. From HVAC checkups to landscaping prep, here's your complete guide.
content:
Prepare Your Austin Home for Spring

As temperatures rise in Central Texas, it's time to give your home some attention. Here are our top recommendations for spring maintenance.

1. HVAC System Checkup

Before the Austin summer heat kicks in, schedule a professional AC inspection. This can prevent costly breakdowns when you need cooling most.

2. Check Your Plumbing

Winter can be tough on pipes, even in Austin. Look for any signs of leaks or damage around your home.

3. Refresh Your Landscaping

Spring is the perfect time to mulch, plant, and prepare your lawn for the growing season.

Need help with any of these tasks? Contact Acme Services for a free consultation.

title: How to Save on Energy Bills in Austin: A Complete Guide
description: Practical tips to reduce your energy costs in Austin, TX. Learn about insulation, HVAC efficiency, and smart home upgrades that pay for themselves.
content:
Lower Your Energy Bills in Austin

With Austin's hot summers, energy bills can skyrocket. Here's how to keep costs under control while staying comfortable.

Upgrade Your Insulation

Many Austin homes, especially older ones, have inadequate insulation. Upgrading can reduce cooling costs by up to 30%.

Smart Thermostat Installation

A programmable thermostat can save you hundreds annually by optimizing your HVAC schedule.

Regular HVAC Maintenance

Annual tune-ups keep your system running efficiently. Learn about our HVAC services.

title: 5 Things to Look for When Hiring a Home Service Contractor in Austin
description: Don't get burned by a bad contractor. Here's what Austin homeowners should check before hiring any home service professional.
content:
Choosing the Right Contractor in Austin

Hiring a contractor can be stressful. Use this checklist to make sure you're working with a reputable professional.

1. Verify Licensing

Texas requires specific licenses for electrical, plumbing, and HVAC work. Always ask to see credentials.

2. Check Insurance

Make sure the contractor carries liability insurance and workers' comp.

3. Read Reviews

Check Google Reviews, Yelp, and the BBB for feedback from other Austin homeowners.

4. Get Multiple Quotes

Compare at least three estimates before making a decision.

5. Ask About Warranties

Reputable contractors stand behind their work with written warranties.
